docs.lead_paragraph: Itch -- the very word is enough to start many fingers scratching. For we all itch somewhere for some reason virtually every day of our lives. In winter, dryness is the most common cause of itchy skin. But in summer - thanks to sun, water, plants, insects, heat and humidity, among other factors - the itch can take on epidemic proportions. Though none escape being plagued by this four-letter word, many of us have limited knowledge as to what to do about itching. Some of the most popular remedies, in fact, only aggravate the problem. Others are just a waste of money and effort.
